This includes stealing from stalls, pickpocketing from NPCs, picking fruit in the Sorceress's Garden and looting grand gold chests within Pyramid Plunder. The chances of getting it are dependent on the player's thieving level, and the person/object the player is stealing from.

Rocky is a skilling pet that can be obtained when training the Thieving skill. This includes stealing from stalls, pickpocketing from NPCs, picking fruit in the Sorceress's Garden and looting grand gold chests within Pyramid Plunder. The chances of getting it are dependent on the player's thieving level, and the person/object the player is stealing from.

When a player receives the pet, it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a red message in the chatbox will state You have a funny feeling like you're being followed. However, if the player's inventory is full and they have a follower already, they will not receive the pet.

On death, if a player loses their pet (as a follower or in your inventory) it will wander around for 30 seconds before disappearing completely.

Players can pay a one-time fee of 500,000 coins to Probita in East Ardougne to have this pet insured. If the pet is lost while insured, it can be reclaimed for 1,000,000 coins.

Contents

  • 1 Variants
  • 2 Drop rates
  • 3 Dialogue
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 References

Variants[edit | edit source]

Players can change Rocky's appearance by using berries on him. When redberries are used, it will change to a red panda named Red, and when poison ivy berries are used, it will change to a tanuki named Ziggy. To change him back into his original form, players must use white berries on him.

Berry Image Chathead
White berries
Redberries
Poison ivy berries

Drop rates[edit | edit source]

Shown below are the base chances of receiving Rocky.[1]

A player's actual chances of receiving it is 1 in (B - (Lvl * 25)), where B is the base chance and Lvl is the player's Thieving level.

The fastest method on average to receive Rocky is by rapidly thieving stalls in Rellekka, Prifddinas or Draynor Village Marketplace. To do this effectively, the Market Guards should be lured away to not attack the thief, using an alternate account or having a friend help. An alternative is thieving only the Grand Gold Chest in Pyramid Plunder.

For methods to trap the market guards in Draynor Village and Prifddinas, see Draynor Village#Marketplace and Guard (Prifddinas)#Trapping market guards.

For Pyramid Plunder, the effective proximate rate if one opens the chest in every room is 1/2084.

Stalls Base chance Pickpocketing Base chance

Cake 124,066 Watchman 134,625
Crafting 47,718 Paladin 127,056
Monkey food 47,718 Gnome 108,718

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article has an associated transcript page.
Click here for the transcript.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
25 June 2020
(update)

Various typos within Red and Ziggy's dialogue have been fixed.

18 June 2020
(update | poll)

Rocky was given the ability to change its appearance via the use of various berries, with each new variant having unique dialogue.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The name is a reference to The Beatles' song Rocky Raccoon.
  • One of the possible dialogues for the red panda version is a reference to the 1994 film The Shawshank Redemption, as the player asks Red if it knows a raccoon named Dufresne, both the names of the two main characters.
  • The Ziggy's reference of being able to change into a human could be a reference to the 1994 film Pom Poko by Studio Ghibli where, according to the mythology, tanukis are able to transform into anything.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 26 September 2016. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Kieren: "Okay... first one! Thieving pet rates! Others soon :). Retweet! [1]"
  2. ↑ Chance is rolled upon picking a fruit from any Garden.
  3. ↑ Jagex. Mod Roq's Twitter account. 22 June 2017. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Roq: "Infernal skilling drop rates: Heron = 1/160000 - (fishing level*25) Rocky = 1/176743 - (thieving level*25)"
  4. ↑ Chance is rolled upon opening the Grand Gold Chest in the room.

'''Rocky''' is a skilling [[pet]] that can be obtained when training the [[Thieving]] skill. This includes stealing from stalls, pickpocketing from NPCs, picking fruit in the [[Sorceress's Garden]] and looting grand gold chests within [[Pyramid Plunder]]. The chances of getting it are dependent on the player's thieving level, and the person/object the player is stealing from.

When a player receives the pet, it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a red message in the [[Chat Interface|chatbox]] will state {{Colour|#ef1020|You have a funny feeling like you're being followed.}} However, if the player's inventory is full '''and''' they have a follower already, they '''will not''' receive the pet.

On death, if a player loses their pet (as a follower or in your inventory) it will wander around for 30 seconds before disappearing completely.

Players can pay a one-time fee of 500,000 [[coins]] to [[Probita]] in [[East Ardougne]] to have this pet insured. If the pet is lost while insured, it can be reclaimed for 1,000,000 [[coins]].

==Variants==
Players can change Rocky's appearance by using berries on him. When [[redberries]] are used, it will change to a {{wp|red panda}} named Red, and when [[poison ivy berries]] are used, it will change to a {{wp|Japanese raccoon dog|tanuki}} named Ziggy. To change him back into his original form, players must use [[white berries]] on him.

==Drop rates==
Shown below are the base chances of receiving Rocky.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Kieren|url=https://twitter.com/JagexKieren/status/780410304731709440|date=26 September 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/3orLf|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=Okay... first one! Thieving pet rates! Others soon :). Retweet! [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CtSTBe9XEAABH3h.jpg]}}

A player's actual chances of receiving it is '''1 in (''B'' - (''Lvl'' * 25))''', where ''B'' is the base chance and ''Lvl'' is the player's Thieving level.

The fastest method on average to receive Rocky is by rapidly thieving stalls in [[Rellekka]], [[Prifddinas]] or [[Draynor Village#Marketplace|Draynor Village Marketplace]]. To do this effectively, the [[Market Guard (Draynor)|Market Guards]] should be lured away to not attack the thief, using an [[Account#Legitimate usage|alternate account]] or having a friend help. An alternative is thieving only the [[Grand Gold Chest]] in Pyramid Plunder.

For methods to trap the market guards in Draynor Village and Prifddinas, see [[Draynor Village#Marketplace]] and [[Guard (Prifddinas)#Trapping market guards]].

For Pyramid Plunder, the effective proximate rate if one opens the chest in every room is 1/2084.

==Trivia==
*The name is a reference to The Beatles' song ''{{wp|Rocky Raccoon}}''.
*One of the possible dialogues for the red panda version is a reference to the 1994 film ''{{wp|The Shawshank Redemption}}'', as the player asks Red if it knows a raccoon named Dufresne, both the names of the two main characters.
*The Ziggy's reference of being able to change into a human could be a reference to the 1994 film Pom Poko by Studio Ghibli where, according to the mythology, tanukis are able to transform into anything.
